name: Instant Pot® Tomato and Beef Sauce
author: Bren
summary: Tomato and beef sauce with a hint of wine for your pasta. I've made this fairly basic but feel free to adjust the seasoning to your tastes.
ingredients: ½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
1 (28 ounce) can whole peeled San Marzano tomatoes, crushed with a fork
directions: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®)
Select Saute function and adjust the setting to low
Add ground beef and season with salt and pepper
Cook until browned and crumbly, about 5 minutes
Add onion, garlic, and Italian seasoning to the pot and saute until tender, about 5 minutes
Select Saute function again and adjust the setting to high heat
Saute for an additional 4 to 5 minutes, stirring infrequently to allow brown bits to form on the bottom of the pot
Pour in red wine to deglaze
Add both tomatoes and browned beef mixture; stir to combine
Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 10 minutes
Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build
Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes
Release any additional pressure carefully using the quick-release method, about 5 minutes
Add lemon juice and simmer for 3 to 4 minutes
